jobs.title: Open Application
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

Join Our Marketing Team at Raiku

We are at a pivotal moment in our growth, focused on amplifying our core strengths and building the future of our industry. Our company, Raiku, is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from the ground up, making global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. We believe financial infrastructure should be fast, reliable, and predictable—and our technology, built on Solana, makes that a reality.

While our foundation is deeply technical, we know that a powerful vision needs an equally powerful voice. If you are a creative, strategic, and data-driven marketing professional who can translate complex technology into compelling narratives, we want to hear from you.

What We Look For in Marketing Professionals

We are not just looking for marketers; we are looking for strategic partners who can help us tell our story and connect with our audience. We value individuals who embody the following:

  • Storytelling Excellence: You can translate our deep technical vision and complex protocol innovation into clear, engaging, and impactful stories for a variety of audiences, from seasoned developers to institutional investors.

  • Strategic Vision: You have a bias for action and can turn ambitious marketing goals into concrete, executable plans, whether it's for a product launch, a content campaign, or a community event.

  • Ownership & Collaboration: You take full ownership of your work, thrive in a high-ownership, remote-first environment, and collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.

  • High EQ & Curiosity: You are a natural relationship-builder with a deep curiosity about our technology and the ecosystem we operate in. You can align with stakeholders and adapt your approach to connect with the right audience.

Open Marketing Positions

Even if you don't see a specific marketing role listed that matches your experience, we encourage you to get in touch. We are always looking for exceptional talent to join our team, and we believe that the right person can help us define our next chapter.

If you believe you can help us amplify our innovation and contribute to our unique culture, please introduce yourself. Send your resume and a brief note telling us why you'd be a great fit for our team and what kind of impact you'd like to make. We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Senior Rust Engineer (Core)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

Location: Remote (Europe-friendly time zones preferred)
Type: Full-Time
Compensation: Competitive Salary + Token Allocation

About Raiku

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.

The Role

As a Senior Rust Core Engineer at Raiku, you will spearhead our engineering efforts, driving the innovation and implementation of next-generation high-performance distributed systems. You will work with a highly proficient team of core engineers who have all contributed to foundational and novel network components.

We believe in hiring only exceptional individuals who are highly motivated to work on complex core infrastructure challenges and are motivated by a coherent system design philosophy that will drive our industry forward. Expect frequent group discussions on architecture, new design specs and code reviews. We are all deeply committed to frequently shipping quality code.

About the Engineering Team

As a team, we are building an entire platform written in Rust, which connects the L1 and L2s and allows us to create deeply complex scenarios and interactions with the running network. While your primary focus for this role is Rust and complex interactions with different components, you will likely also be involved in infrastructure (e.g., k8s), script writing, and supporting projects in other languages (e.g., Go). Working at every level of the stack is necessary to understand the big picture and how everything is wired together.

Responsibilities

  • Highly motivated to contribute to our mission and be part of something bigger. Excited to work on projects that are ground-breaking and complex

  • Refactor, improve and lead software design implementation

  • Communicate effectively with the team and document your code. It is also expected that founding engineers mentor less experienced engineers.

  • Read and understand protocol specifications and be able to break them into issues and turn them into Rust code.

  • Maintaining a large codebase with many components and keeping it well-designed, future-proofed, modular and highly performant

  • Automate security testing processes and benchmarks, creating innovative tools and frameworks for continuously improving our systems.

What You'll Bring:

  • A bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, coupled with practical experience in blockchain systems.

  • At least 3 years of experience in distributed systems, with a deep technical understanding of L1 and L2 architectures.

  • Strong proficiency in Rust, with at least 2-3 years of Rust experience.

  • Strongly emphasising writing performant and secure code.

  • Demonstrated experience in designing, developing, and deploying scalable distributed systems.

  • An analytical mindset with the ability to anticipate and mitigate emerging security threats, leveraging a comprehensive understanding of the blockchain landscape.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Active open-source contributions in core protocol engineering (such as Firedancer, Reth, Lighthouse, Geth, …).

  • Direct involvement in the Solana ecosystem, with contributions to Solana's runtime, scheduler, or other core systems.

  • Experience writing Solana Program Library (SPL) and Anchor or similar frameworks 

  • Active engagement with the blockchain security research community, evidenced by contributions to open-source projects, publications, or presentations at notable conferences.

Benefits

  • Competitive remuneration packages based on iterative market research, including tokens

  • Remote-first and self-initiating with flexible hours

  • Work with team players who are genuinely excited about their impact and projects.

  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment that fosters innovation and recognises individual contributions to collective success

  • Opportunities for professional growth and advancement within a rapidly growing technological frontier

jobs.title: Lead, Validator & Staking Growth (Solana)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

About Raiku

Raiku makes Solana inevitable by making every transaction fast, reliable, and predictable.

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our protocol delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss and trades to revert.

By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku gives developers and institutions the reliability and control they demand.

Role Overview

As the Lead of Validator & Staking Growth (Solana), you will own and drive Raiku’s validator engagement strategy. You will lead efforts to build relationships with top-tier validators, navigate technical conversations, and ensure successful adoption of Raiku’s infrastructure across the validator ecosystem. This is a critical, high-ownership role that will shape Raiku’s validator strategy, go-to-market efforts, and partnership model as we prepare for mainnet.

Key Responsibilities

Growth Strategy & Validator Partnerships

  • Define and execute the validator onboarding and growth strategy, aligned with Raiku’s milestones

  • Build and manage the validator BD pipeline, driving clear metrics for adoption and engagement

  • Lead outreach and relationship-building efforts with top Solana validators

  • Build and maintain deep relationships with key validator operators, ensuring alignment with Raiku’s roadmap

  • Advocate for Raiku’s value proposition, communicating benefits to validators and the wider ecosystem

Validator Onboarding & Success Program

  • Drive a structured, repeatable onboarding process for validators that ensures long-term success and engagement. Partner closely with the engineering team to ensure technical alignment and smooth validator onboarding

  • Design and maintain onboarding guides, validator documentation, and FAQs in line with Raiku’s core components / concepts such as our Sidecar, Ackermann Node and Slot Marketplace

  • Proactively support validators through the integration process, including technical troubleshooting.

  • Monitor validator adoption post-onboarding and implement feedback loops to improve their experience.

Validator Incentive Design & Feedback

  • Collaborate with strategy, BD, engineering and research teams to shape Raiku’s validator incentive model.

  • Gather real-world validator insights on reward structures, market needs (e.g., MEV sharing, slot allocation), and upcoming SIMDs.

  • Along with the engineering and research teams as well as external specialist service providers, help refine Raiku’s tokenomics, incentive alignment strategies, and validator performance frameworks.

  • Advocate for validator needs during incentive model development and Raiku’s economic design process.

Risk Mitigation & Compliance Awareness

  • Understand validator risk profiles (e.g., slashing, regulation, compliance) and help design engagement strategies that account for these factors.

  • Advise validators on risk areas associated with new features like decoupled block-building and slot marketplace participation.

  • Work closely with legal / compliance advisors to ensure validator-facing processes align with relevant regulations and de-risk the Raiku - Validator relationship

Ecosystem Engagement

  • Represent Raiku at ecosystem events, validator forums, and technical workshops

  • Facilitate educational initiatives and create resources for validator partners

  • Act as the primary point of contact for validator stakeholders, addressing concerns and gathering feedback

Market Intelligence & Reporting

  • Identify and prioritize validator segments based on stake, network influence, and strategic alignment

  • Track Solana validator landscape trends, policy changes (e.g., SIMDs), and emerging technologies

  • Provide insights to the product, engineering, and leadership teams to inform roadmap and strategy

  • Collaborate with marketing on ecosystem positioning, validator content, and success stories

What We’re Looking For

  • 3+ years of experience in blockchain infrastructure, validator operations, or business development roles at Solana native validators

  • Deep understanding of the Solana validator ecosystem, MEV dynamics, and network economics

  • Proven ability to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders across the validator and staking landscape

  • Excellent communication, relationship-building, and problem-solving skills

  • Startup mentality: ownership, autonomy, and execution in fast-paced environments

Nice to Have

  • Experience at a leading validator firm or blockchain infrastructure project

  • Existing network of validator partners across Solana and other chains

  • Familiarity with block-building, pre-confirmations, and slot marketplace concepts

  • Technical understanding of distributed systems, consensus protocols, and Solana architecture

What We Offer

  • A chance to join a category-defining protocol team pushing the frontier of Solana infrastructure

  • Competitive salary, token allocation and performance-based bonuses as well as a key role in shaping Raiku’s ecosystem footprint

  • Remote-first team with async workflows, a high ownership culture, and deep technical curiosity

  • Budget for travel, ecosystem events, and home office setup

jobs.title: Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

Location: Remote (Europe-friendly time zones preferred)
Type: Full-Time
Compensation: Competitive Salary + Token Allocation

Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer at Raiku

As an Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer at Raiku, you will lead critical engineering efforts that drive the performance and scalability of next-generation distributed systems. You’ll join a highly proficient team of core engineers, all of whom have contributed to foundational and novel infrastructure innovations.

We believe in hiring exceptional individuals who are deeply motivated by complex core infrastructure challenges and guided by a coherent system design philosophy that moves our industry forward. Expect frequent group discussions on architecture, design specs, and code reviews. We ship quality code quickly and often — and we are deeply committed to it.

About Raiku

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.

About the Team

Our entire platform is built in Rust, connecting Solana’s L1 with advanced L2 extensions and enabling deeply complex network interactions. Your primary focus in this role will involve Rust systems programming, infrastructure architecture (e.g., Kubernetes), and operational scripting across languages such as Rust, Go, and Typescript. Full-stack understanding — from bare metal to application interfaces — is critical to success here.


What You'll Bring

  • 4+ years of experience in infrastructure engineering, preferably within high-standard fintech, data, cloud, or DevOps environments.

  • Senior-level experience as an SRE or Infrastructure Engineer with a strong Kubernetes background.

  • Deep proficiency with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform/Terragrunt) and infrastructure automation (Helm, GitOps).

  • Familiarity with monitoring and alerting using Prometheus and PromQL.

  • Experience with infrastructure and data security practices, including KMS and HashiCorp Vault.

  • Ability to ship high-quality, opinionated architectural choices and uphold software best practices.

  • Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken).

Our Stack

  • Infrastructure: AWS/GCP + bare metal, Kubernetes, Terraform/Terragrunt, Prometheus/Thanos, Helm, HashiCorp Vault, FluxCD

  • Languages: Rust, Golang, Typescript, PostgreSQL

  • Smart Contract Development: Anchor, Solana Program Library (SPL)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience operating validators on distributed networks.

  • Active engagement with the blockchain security research community, through open-source contributions, publications, or speaking at conferences.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation packages based on ongoing market analysis, including tokens.

  • Remote-first culture with flexible hours — self-initiative and independence are highly valued.

  • Work with highly talented engineers passionate about building the future of the internet.

  • A collaborative and dynamic work environment that rewards individual ownership and impact.

  • Opportunities for rapid professional growth within one of the most technically ambitious projects in web3.

jobs.title: DevRel
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

Developer Relations Lead

Our company is entering a new phase of growth, defined by a powerful long-term technical vision and deep protocol innovation. Our CTO is a "chief technical evangelist," and we are looking for a strategic partner to help scale this crucial function.

About Raiku

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.

As our first Developer Relations Lead, you will be the bridge between our core protocol team and the global developer ecosystem. You will not only communicate our long-term vision but also empower developers to build on our platform, ensuring they have a world-class experience.

You will be instrumental in de-risking our execution and unblocking our innovation engine by fostering a thriving community of builders and providing a clear feedback loop to our engineering team.

What You'll Do

  • Evangelize the Vision: Act as our primary technical evangelist, communicating our protocol's "why" and "what" to the developer community through engaging content and presentations.

  • Create a World-Class Developer Experience: Develop and maintain technical content, including documentation, tutorials, blog posts, and code examples that make it easy for new and existing developers to build on our protocol.

  • Build the Community: Foster and nurture a vibrant developer community through online forums (e.g., Discord, Twitter), in-person meetups, workshops, and hackathons.

  • Be the Voice of the Developer: Gather feedback from the ecosystem and advocate for their needs, translating pain points and feature requests into actionable insights for our engineering and product teams.

  • Speak with Authority: Represent our company at conferences and industry events, delivering technical talks and demonstrations that highlight the power and potential of our protocol.

Who You Are

You have a rare blend of technical depth and exceptional communication skills. You are a natural educator and a builder at heart who understands that our success is directly tied to the success of our developer ecosystem.

  • Technical Credibility: You have a strong background in software engineering, ideally with a deep, systems-level understanding of distributed systems and a proven ability to write production-grade code. Experience with languages like Rust is a significant plus.

  • An Exceptional Communicator: You are a compelling writer and an engaging public speaker who can simplify complex technical concepts for a diverse audience, from crypto-natives to web2 developers.

  • A Servant Leader: You are passionate about helping others succeed and are a natural at providing guidance and support. You are comfortable mentoring and answering technical questions in a public forum.

  • A Strategic Thinker: You are proactive and can operate autonomously to define and execute a Dev Rel strategy that aligns with the company’s broader goals.

Why Join Us

This is a ground-floor opportunity to build the developer relations function at a company poised for significant growth. You will work directly with our CTO and a world-class team of engineers.

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.

As our first Developer Relations Lead, you will be the bridge between our core protocol team and the global developer ecosystem. You will not only communicate our long-term vision but also empower developers to build on our platform, ensuring they have a world-class experience.

You will be instrumental in de-risking our execution and unblocking our innovation engine by fostering a thriving community of builders and providing a clear feedback loop to our engineering team.


WHAT YOU'LL DO

 - Evangelize the Vision: Act as our primary technical evangelist, communicating our protocol's "why" and "what" to the developer community through engaging content and presentations.

 - Create a World-Class Developer Experience: Develop and maintain technical content, including documentation, tutorials, blog posts, and code examples that make it easy for new and existing developers to build on our protocol.

 - Build the Community: Foster and nurture a vibrant developer community through online forums (e.g., Discord, Twitter), in-person meetups, workshops, and hackathons.

 - Be the Voice of the Developer: Gather feedback from the ecosystem and advocate for their needs, translating pain points and feature requests into actionable insights for our engineering and product teams.

 - Speak with Authority: Represent our company at conferences and industry events, delivering technical talks and demonstrations that highlight the power and potential of our protocol.


WHO YOU ARE

You have a rare blend of technical depth and exceptional communication skills. You are a natural educator and a builder at heart who understands that our success is directly tied to the success of our developer ecosystem.

 - Technical Credibility: You have a strong background in software engineering, ideally with a deep, systems-level understanding of distributed systems and a proven ability to write production-grade code. Experience with languages like Rust is a significant plus.

 - An Exceptional Communicator: You are a compelling writer and an engaging public speaker who can simplify complex technical concepts for a diverse audience, from crypto-natives to web2 developers.

 - A Servant Leader: You are passionate about helping others succeed and are a natural at providing guidance and support. You are comfortable mentoring and answering technical questions in a public forum.

 - A Strategic Thinker: You are proactive and can operate autonomously to define and execute a Dev Rel strategy that aligns with the company’s broader goals.


WHY JOIN US

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stay in the loop.
Follow @raikucom on Twitter for product updates, engineering deep dives, and a closer look at how we’re building the future of blockspace.

We're in an exciting phase of growth, unlocking our next chapter of innovation and amplifying our core strengths.

Our company is built on a foundation of long-term technical vision and deep protocol R&D. We're a team of visionaries and executors, focused on building the future of our industry.

We are always looking for exceptional talent to join our team. If you're a builder, a visionary, or an operational leader who thrives in a high-ownership, remote-first environment, we want to hear from you.

About Raiku

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.

What We Look For

We value individuals who embody a unique combination of skills and mindsets:

  • Technical Excellence: You're a deeply credible engineer with a passion for systems-level thinking and high-performance distributed systems.

  • A Bias for Action: You are a pragmatic problem-solver who can translate abstract visions into concrete, executable plans.

  • Ownership & Leadership: You take full ownership of your work, a true servant leader who is dedicated to enabling the success of your team and the company.

  • High EQ & Collaboration: You understand the power of partnership, able to build relationships and align with a diverse range of stakeholders.

Open Positions

Even if you don't see a specific role listed that matches your experience, we encourage you to get in touch. We're always open to connecting with talented people who are excited by our mission.

If you believe you can help us amplify our innovation, increase our operational excellence, and contribute to our unique culture, please introduce yourself by sending your resume and a brief note to tell us why you'd be a great fit for our team and what kind of impact you'd like to make.
